intro: Acinodendron undatum, commonly known as the African velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to sub-Saharan Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its large, palmately lobed leaves and showy, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, tropical environments and is often found in wetlands and along riverbanks. The species is noted for its ornamental value and has been used in traditional medicine in some regions.
